title: Bi-Weekly Career and Hiring Discussion Thread
selftext:
Hello r/india! If you need any suggestions/help regarding your career, ask here. If your company is hiring or if you are looking for a job, then post here.

**If You or Your Company is Hiring:**

1. Name of the company
2. Location
3. Requirements
4. Preferred way of contacting you

**If You are looking to get hired**

1. Your skillset/experience
2. Portfolio (if any/applicable)
3. Location
4. Preferred way of contacting you

Please do not mention your emails. You can/should prefer to take conversation forward in PMs instead to avoid any privacy mishaps.

Do follow up here with your experience. Did you get a job or hire someone successfully via these threads? Your feedback helps!

**Career Thread is posted every two weeks on Thursday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Career+and+Hiring+thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/osdztmrfx8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=dab56a83877ffe7dc6fd93767a8f63e9c366e592
comments:
# Frontend Engineer @ Babblebots Inc

# About Us

We are Babblebots Inc, a platform using Voice-technology and AI to help users speak and communicate better. We are a team of IITians building a disruptive platform using voice technology, AI and ML for helping users speak better, and upskill their communication skills. We are working on long-form conversations over audio/voice, to pass the Turing Test of real-life conversations.

# About The Role

We are looking for a frontend engineer who has experience building voice-enabled web apps.

## Experience

* 2yrs or more full-time Industry experience - not freelancing or part-time
* Please do NOT apply if you have a notice period greater than 2 months
* Job location is Mumbai from Jan 2022.

## Qualifications

* Experience developing web app(s) that utilise audio and video streaming.
* Be proficient in Javascript, HTML, CSS
* Experienced in one of the modern Javascript frameworks such as React, Angular or Vue
* Experience working with ES6, HTML5, data visualization libraries like D3, ECharts, Chart.js.
* Comfortable with Git, CLI, and GitHub
* Experience working with REST APIs.
* Excellent understanding of Mobile Responsiveness, Cross Browser Compatibility, and Accessibility.

## How to Apply

AngelList: [https://angel.co/l/2w89vn](https://angel.co/l/2w89vn) . In case of any queries reach out to me over DMs!

light_cleaned_comments: # Frontend Engineer @ Babblebots Inc # About Us We are Babblebots Inc, a platform using Voice-technology and AI to help users speak and communicate better. We are a team of IITians building a disruptive platform using voice technology, AI and ML for helping users speak better, and upskill their communication skills. We are working on long-form conversations over audio/voice, to pass the Turing Test of real-life conversations. # About The Role We are looking for a frontend engineer who has experience building voice-enabled web apps. ## Experience * 2yrs or more full-time Industry experience - not freelancing or part-time * Please do NOT apply if you have a notice period greater than 2 months * Job location is Mumbai from Jan 2022. ## Qualifications * Experience developing web app(s) that utilise audio and video streaming. * Be proficient in Javascript, HTML, CSS * Experienced in one of the modern Javascript frameworks such as React, Angular or Vue * Experience working with ES6, HTML5, data visualization libraries like D3, ECharts, Chart.js. * Comfortable with Git, CLI, and GitHub * Experience working with REST APIs. * Excellent understanding of Mobile Responsiveness, Cross Browser Compatibility, and Accessibility. ## How to Apply AngelList: [https://angel.co/l/2w89vn](https://angel.co/l/2w89vn) . In case of any queries reach out to me over DMs! Just a few questions; - Whats wrong with a genuine freelancer who has worked on contract with a steady client (not one off Fiverr projects)? - I see from your Angel profile, that you folks seem to be a young, small and nimble startup, whats wrong in staying remote given that you are recruiting an experienced candidate?
